tasks.description: Collect raw performance data from a target website (e.g., response times, bytes transferred, caching headers).
Analyze the collected data to compute grades for performance, usability, and overall quality, and identify areas for improvement.
Compile the analysis into a structured report format, including summaries, graphs, and actionable recommendations.
Present the report data in a user-friendly interface or integrate it into another application.
Store or expose the generated report via a RESTful endpoint for retrieval or further processing.
Format the collected metrics and grades into a user-friendly report format (HTML/JSON)
Authenticate with MotorsportReg.com and retrieve T&S data for selected race events
Parse and store retrieved T&S data into AXti.me's database, linking participants and vehicles
Compute final scores and rankings based on timing data
Generate downloadable reports and display real‑time results on AXti.me dashboards
Maintain secure session and handle authentication tokens between services
Confirm successful upload and handle errors
Send email notifications to stakeholders after successful data upload.
Acquire ocean statistics via available public APIs or data feeds (temperature, currents, biodiversity, etc.)
Transform and aggregate the retrieved data into map-ready formats (geoJSON, heat maps, layers)
Overlay the processed data onto an interactive map using the Google Maps API
Implement user controls for filtering, zooming, and querying specific ocean metrics
Generate visual analytics (charts, heatmaps, trend lines) based on the ocean data and display them alongside the map
Create exportable reports (PDF/CSV) summarizing the selected ocean data for download
Fetch real-time website traffic data (visitors, page views, referrers) for a specified domain.
Compute a website valuation score using traffic statistics, engagement metrics, and comparison benchmarks.
Produce aggregated ad performance reports, including metrics breakdown by campaign, ad group, keyword, and geographic location.
Build dashboards and generate reports summarizing traffic, valuation, and advertising performance.
Correlate the performance data with traffic/valuation metrics to identify performance-impact on value.
Integrate with third‑party analytics platforms to enrich data streams
Like or unlike a specific pin.
Call Canada Post’s tracking endpoint to fetch status, location, and timestamps for a given tracking number.
Render the obtained location data on a Google Maps widget, providing a visual representation of the parcel’s journey.
Display parcel location on Google Maps within the mashup interface
Integrate the above components into a single web service or widget that accepts a Canada Post tracking number and renders the map with real‑time updates
Provide user input handling (e.g., entering tracking numbers) and error handling for invalid or missing data.
Develop a lightweight UI component that displays the tracking timeline and map view
Retrieve current bus locations, routes, and stops from the CTA data feed.
Track a selected bus and detect when it reaches a user‑chosen stop.
Trigger a client‑side pop‑up notification to alert the user when the target stop is reached.
Send a pop‑up or notification to the user's computer when the alarm condition is met.
Display bus positions and routes on an interactive map within the web application
Implement a notification system that triggers a pop‑up window when a monitored bus reaches the user’s selected stop.
Collect the user's current geographic coordinates via the browser or device GPS.
Render a Google Map centered on the user's coordinates and update it dynamically as the location changes.
Send a request to the Google Places API to retrieve nearby places based on the current location.
Send a request to the Yahoo Local Search API to retrieve nearby businesses for the current location.
Merge the results from both APIs, handle duplicates, and display them in a unified list or on the map.
Continuously monitor location changes and automatically refresh map and search results in real time.
Handle errors, rate limits, and fallback UI when external services fail.
Query the DBpedia endpoint to obtain labels (all available languages) and geo-coordinates for every concept.
For each concept, query the Flickr API using the labels and geo-coordinates to find relevant photos and compile a local collection.
Store the resulting concept‑photo mappings in a searchable data store for serving to downstream applications.
Persist the retrieved photo URLs/metadata, linking them to the appropriate DBpedia concept
Persist the aggregated collections in a scalable storage system for later access and analysis.
Store or expose the resulting concept‑photo mappings in a structured format (e.g., JSON, database).
Access and download the TriMet MAX line geographic and schedule data (e.g., GeoJSON, OpenStreetMap extracts, or TriMet public API endpoints).
Parse and structure the station information for each line (station names, coordinates, accessible routes).
Integrate the parsed data into Google Maps by adding markers for stations and polylines for routes.
Implement user interaction (clicking markers shows station details, possibly with real‑time status).
Implement real‑time updates or refresh mechanisms for route changes or delays.
Retrieve repository list and metadata from the OpenDOAR API or published data feeds
Fetch repository growth data from the ROAR repository growth charts API or dataset
Geocode each repository address to obtain latitude and longitude coordinates for map placement
Generate visual growth charts (e.g., line charts) from the collected growth statistics
Compose a unified web interface that combines the map and charts, enabling filtering by country, year, or repository type.
Aggregate historical repository counts to produce growth metrics.
Provide chart data or basic chart rendering to visualize repository growth.
Integrate all components into a web-based mashup interface.
Generate a Google Map (or similar) displaying Andrew Speaker's journey across the Atlantic.
Retrieve and associate any available data about the patient's journey (e.g., stops, coordinates) for display.
Render the calculated route on a Google Map interface, providing visual and possibly interactive elements.
Expose stored data via a REST endpoint for external map services to consume
Query Digg's API or RSS/JSON feed to obtain the latest items matching the minimum digg count and count of items preferences.
Filter and sort the retrieved items based on the specified minimum number of diggs.
Extract content and image URLs from each item and prepare them for rendering in the widget.
Render a widget that presents each item's headline, content snippet, and main image.
Persist and retrieve user preferences (minimum digg count, item count) and schedule periodic updates.
Provide UI elements for users to adjust minimum digg threshold and item count preferences
Implement a search endpoint that accepts filters such as location, sport type, and difficulty to return a list of matching route diagrams.
Provide an endpoint to retrieve detailed information and geometry for a selected route diagram, including metadata like length, elevation gain, and recommended equipment.
Expose a query API that accepts search parameters (keywords, activity type, location, difficulty) and returns relevant route diagram listings, optionally enriched with map URLs or preview images.
Provide filtering options for sport type, difficulty, and geographic area.
Display and manage advertisement units on the search results page.
Send push notifications and in‑app messages about route updates
Retrieve and display flight schedules, availability, and pricing for user-selected routes.
Gather hotel listings, room availability, and rates for targeted destinations.
Provide attraction and activity recommendations based on user preferences and location.
Generate a detailed itinerary with all booked services and a cost breakdown.
Create invoices and process payments for booked travel services.
Authenticate users, manage sessions, and store user profiles
Recommend personalized travel destinations, activities, and deals
Provide real‑time chat between travelers and support or among travelers
Create and host a custom interactive widget to display travel information on a website or social media platform
Persist trip data and provide export options (PDF, CSV, etc.)
Fetch a high‑resolution satellite image for a specific latitude/longitude.
Provide a world map view capable of being queried for location based on user selection.
Implement the matching logic between the satellite image and the corresponding map location.
Provide APIs or SDK hooks for integrating the imagery and matching UI into a game application.
Enable real‑time communication or notifications for multiplayer or leaderboards.
Enable real‑time chat between players during the game.
Acquire real‑time GPS data streams for the University of Michigan bus fleet
Render an interactive map and plot bus positions with markers
Implement AJAX polling or WebSocket for continuous location updates
Allow users to filter buses by route, stop, or service line.
Provide a contentful‑based API endpoint that returns route and schedule data in JSON format for consumer applications
